website_summaries.verdict: A fantastic option for buyers needing a heavy-duty down jacket for extreme weather conditions.
pros: 700 fill power down is moisture resistant for supreme comfort in wet weather
Built-in zippered chest pocket for small belongings
Velcro hand cuffs for perfect fit

customer_reviews.title: Scam!! Do not purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a scam. I received a knock off jacket by a company called Wantdo with a Marmot tag attached to it.
customer_reviews.author: Trenton B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the pictures
customer_reviews.text: I received this jacket and was very disappointed. I was looking for a heavy down jacket to wear on sometimes -30 degree days in Gunnison, CO. This is little more than a shell layer. In the pictures it looks big and puffy like coats I've gotten from Mountain Hardware and North Face in the past. My recommendation would be to buy those brands because I don't know where the 700 fill went, but it appears to have not gone in the jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Eyeball Guy

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I live in ridiculously cold Chicago and I already owned several winter down coats including North Face, Triple Fat Goose[ my previous favorite] and Mark Jones. I was still not totally happy with any of them. I bought this coat and it arrived yesterday. I don't want to take it off. It is very warm but soft and lightweight also. The pockets and hood are lined with down making them very warm. I don't even need to have a hat because the hood is that warm. I still don't like winter in Chicago but this coat will help a lot!!
customer_reviews.author: David E.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great jacket! Comfortable and super warm! I read some reviews that stated the jacket was thin and not puffy. My jacket came and it was compressed a bit in the shipping bag. That is easily corrected by fluffing on low temp in the dryer with tennis balls or dryer balls. I washed my jacket right away with Nikwax Down Direct followed by Nikwax Down Proof (fantastic products). I called Marmot and they recommended these products. Once done, I couldn’t believe how the jacket puffed up and is super rain repellent. Highly recommend this jacket and Nikwax product line (sold here on amazon as well).
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cold arms.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this jacket. And it has some great points. Good YKK double zipper. Good hydrophobic down, good fit. Warm core. But the difference in the arms and torso insulation is horrible. My back and chest sweat to the point they I need to open my jacket while the cold and wind cut right through my arms. Marmot, what gives? How could you screw up so badly on sleeve down fill? I can’t wear the jacket above 30 degrees and below that my arms feel like I’m just wearing a vest. Really poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: J. Traynor

customer_reviews.title: Love this really warm down jacket
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket. Super warm, way warmer than your typical puffy. Nice hood that cinches down well. Velcro wrists are a must for me and these work great. Good zipper pulls. So far the quality has been outstanding and the fit is perfect for me. I typically wear this under a shell since I'm in a rainy environment and this jacket fits great under my shells despite it being puffier than your average puffy. Love the lined pockets and that the draw cords are stowed in the pockets instead of dangling around elsewhere. Two way zipper is fab. No complaints, super happy to be so warm on cold days.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Amsler

customer_reviews.title: Good winter coat
customer_reviews.text: Good length for my son who is 6’2” 265 lbs with long arms.... glad I ordered xxl....xl would not have worked
customer_reviews.author: Alaskan Big Mama O

customer_reviews.title: Not as warm as it looks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it was the warmest option on some review sites. I used it in weather -10 to -30 deg C. for 2 weeks. However, the jacket was not as warm as expected, with the arm region being a big cold spot. the stuffing used in this jacket was not as "fluffy" as what my companions was wearing, it achieved noticeably less expansion as something like the north face thunder II jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Warmth.  I live in Bavaria where winters can be savage
customer_reviews.text: This is the flimsiest excuse for a down coat -- thin and probably suitable for the American South. I have another Marmot jacket I bought 6 years ago (almost identical) and it is one of the best warmest coats I have had. I ordered this one because the zipper broke on the other one. Disappointed doesn't begin to describe it -- this is what happens when American companies farm their manufacturing to China. Shame on Marmot. Stay away from this product if you care about staying warm.
customer_reviews.author: AAM1990

customer_reviews.title: Fits the wife great. Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Buy larger than you think you need. Bought it for myself and it was a little small. Fits the wife great. Great quality. Very warm coat !
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great warmth comfort and value for the $
customer_reviews.text: The Marmot Guides Down Hoody is one of their many classic value packed pieces of outerwear. You get a VERY warm jacket filled to the brim with 700 Fill Down, adjustable hood 2 roomy fleece-lined handwarmer pockets Outer AND inner zippered chest pockets for keys and cellphone. 2 way front zipper Elastisized wrist cuffs with Velcro For the money this jacket will rival and beat a LOT of other jackets worth twice as much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacks down, runs small, no water repellent
customer_reviews.text: The chest area has sufficient down but the arms have little so not enough warmth during colder days below 30F. A thick sweater under is ideal except since this runs small so it’s hard to close the zipper. Water repellent is non existent in this jacket. I was exposed to some light rain for a short time and the coat felt very wet Quickly . No beading no nothing. I was very surprised that at this price point it lacked so much. If you get this on sale for at least half price and your not a xxl or bigger(because xxl is the biggest size) you can size up if your a large or medium
customer_reviews.author: norvito velez

customer_reviews.title: It’s very nice true to size not good for extreme cold
customer_reviews.text: Really good feel fits great looks great but it’s not near enough thickness for cold weather of northern states gets much more colder than this jacket can handle this only a spring and fall jacket it was meant for hard cold temperatures so I’m a little disappointed only that it’s only good for around 40 degrees Fahrenheit I need a jacket keep me warm in the below zero temperatures on up to 20 degrees above Fahrenheit This is not for extreme cold other great jacket .
customer_reviews.author: candleman26

customer_reviews.title: Not for Minnesota
customer_reviews.text: Put it on, walked outside here in Minnesota and in something like 3 minutes turned around to go back inside to take it off. At just 5 degrees I could feel the cold seep through the back and arms in something like 3 minutes. No wind, just ambient temperature, so wasn't wind loss. Same weak down jackets for sale everywhere for $99. Back to looking for a decent winter jacket.
customer_reviews.author: alan w.

customer_reviews.title: Great coat with great features
customer_reviews.text: Great coat - very warm but nice and light. Has great features like elastic wrist along with Velcro to make it very adjustable and double zipper at the front to allow loose fit at bottom. Size runs a little small, however - I usually wear a large but on this coat I needed an XLg.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C

customer_reviews.title: Warm & Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Warm. Lightweight. Periscope hood. Soft lining in “hand warmer” pockets. Draw string tightening of bottom and hood. Velcro wrist closures (works well but cuffs or elastic might feel better). I live in northern Minnesota and I have worn this jacket in temperatures as low as -30* F (windchill) and found the jacket to be a capable jacket (I was wearing under layers and wasn’t outside for too long, 30-40 minutes while active). Not a parka but a good lightweight jacket that can hold back the cold weather fairly well. No noticeable down “leakage” thus far but I’ve only had the jacket about a month (since mid November ‘19).
customer_reviews.author: The E Knoweth

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Marmot , a true hit!
customer_reviews.text: This Marmot down jacket is a true winner. Super warm, well constructed yet light weight. For the coldest days this jacket would be my pick. Great fit and well thought out design. You can still look awesome yet be comfortable in this jacket. It is worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: James Stoebe

customer_reviews.title: overpriced, uneven quality
customer_reviews.text: i ordered 2 of these in different sizes, and both had QC issues. neither of them gave the warmth i thought should come with this kind of price tag. wound up getting an ultralight one from EMS that was half the price, half the bulk, better made, and just as warm.
customer_reviews.author: bob mills

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, warm and light parka
customer_reviews.text: This Marmot parka, with it's 700 fill power is an excellent piece of outerwear. It has provided really good warmth during a cold Idaho winter. I've owned other down filled jackets, and this is certainly the best of the bunch.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Zipper is not easy for elderly.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my elderly father. It’s warm but the zipper is not easy for him. He struggles to get it going. I have to help him and admittedly it’s even a trick for me. Hard to give this anything than 1 Star cause a good winter coat isn’t effective if you can’t zipper it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my bf
customer_reviews.text: My bf loves this jacket, we thought it was gonna be thicker but it’s just fine, it keeps him warm on the cool winter days (he doesn’t like puffy thick jackets and this was very slim on him). He wore it for 3 weeks straight because he liked it so much. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Light and Warm
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best coat I ever owned. Light coat but yet it keeps you so warm. A great everyday work and dress coat. Too nice for outdoors fishing / hunting though.
customer_reviews.author: Bassmaster

customer_reviews.title: Quality as described
customer_reviews.text: Buy Medium (1.75 height / 78 kg) fits well....just a t-shirt under....-3°....warmer...ok...proved in city with climate below 0, cause my city is warm in winter no below 0....recommended
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Covarrubias

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Marmot Puffer Jacket!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this jacket!! We live in Alaska, and he says he sweats in this jacket sometimes because it’s so warm. Really nice, and puffy... but not overly so. Great price point for the quality with Marmot!!
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Solid winter/down jacket
customer_reviews.text: Very nice down jacket. Had others that ripped easily from ll bean. This one was cheaper and it’s held up nicely. No holes, and I’ve only noticed a couple of feathers come out in the 2-3 months that I’ve had it. Solid winter jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this coat, he wears it everywhere very comfortable and warm for very frigid cold weather. Great buy worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Nydia Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Just what he needed
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my boyfriend since he needed a good winter coat. I’ve had my Marmot for a few years now and it’s served me very well every fall/winter season. He loved it; fit true to size, as described and was very lightweight. Looked great on him and he really loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Jet Black = Blue Black
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket, did not realize that Jet Black refers to Black with Blue undertones. To me this jacket is obviously Blue when you see it in good lighting. It is a nice color, just not black like I prefer.
customer_reviews.author: chocolate milk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift. It fits perfect and looks really great. Best of all is that it is a down jacket that can be worn in Montana during the really cold months and the semi cold months.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Fossen

customer_reviews.title: very warm jacket
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I didn't like about the jacket, was the outer shell could be made of sturdier material. But otherwise it is a great good weather jacket!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P Butler

customer_reviews.title: Best down I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Love this jacket! Super comfortable, warm and lightweight. My new favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Erock

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacket
customer_reviews.text: No jacket, very warm and fits great. Lined pockets a big plus
customer_reviews.author: John J19

customer_reviews.title: Warm but light
customer_reviews.text: Love how warm and light this jacket seems to be.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent winter coat for the coldest days
customer_reviews.text: Marmot makes great items and this jacket is no exception. Very warm, but still lightweight and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Wheelie

customer_reviews.title: The worst thing about this jacket is how cold the rest of your body will feel
customer_reviews.text: Awesome jacket. Used to climb up more than 18,000 feet and only needed a couple of layers beneath it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: EntJ

customer_reviews.title: Terrific winter coat
customer_reviews.text: Great coat, extremely warm and well made. This coat is will keep you warm down to around 10-15 degrees. Anything colder, you may need something thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Gcas

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: My husbanr really enjoy from it. It light and work enough, at least for NYC.
customer_reviews.author: Shani

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Received on time and in person. Immediately tried it on and went outside to do chores and rake the leaves it kept me extremely warm definitely a great jacket so glad I purchased this thank you Amazon for getting me a good deal
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Like being hugged by a pillow
customer_reviews.text: I like it like that, I like it like that! (The jacket that is)
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great down winter jacket
customer_reviews.text: Awesome down jacket for temperatures down to -20F. I'm able to go out in 10 degree weather with a t-shirt and this jacket on and be nice and warm. Marmot makes some of the best quality clothing IMO
customer_reviews.author: Sean Noble

customer_reviews.title: Well made and super warm!
customer_reviews.text: This coat is remarkable. I love the additional chest pocket for keys and small items.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: great jacket! Bought this to replace an older patagonia ...
customer_reviews.text: great jacket! Bought this to replace an older patagonia down jacket and was worried this would be too heavy. Not at all, it's perfect and very warm. Build construction is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought the XL instead of L
customer_reviews.text: This jacket definitely runs small. Based upon other reviews, I ordered a XL (instead of my typical L). It fits just about perfectly! The jet black color is definitely black (and not navy blue as other reviewers have stated). It's a great jacket!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Pozy

customer_reviews.title: Positive Transaction
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the seller. The purchase was delivered earlier than stated. In very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Spence

customer_reviews.title: warm
customer_reviews.text: warm, not very thick. Wanted thicker and harder outshell. This will rip easily.
customer_reviews.author: Koby The Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Son likes the style and comfort
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for warmth, comfort and not bulky. Used for college son at school.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Pociecha

customer_reviews.title: Very warm
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy down jacket thats great for light activity on a really cold day.
customer_reviews.author: Travel Buff

customer_reviews.title: Great down parka.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent light weight down parka which keeps you quite warm. Well made and designed.
customer_reviews.author: richard reich

customer_reviews.title: phenominal jacket
customer_reviews.text: Liked the warmth and pack-ability. I used this jacket for some winter camping. It is too warm for active wear unless it is subzero but great for hanging outside in cold temps.
customer_reviews.author: George Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and comfortable and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a North Face Summit Series 700 with this jacket. All the features of the NF that I loved but with better constructed pockets and a proper hoodie. Warm!!!
customer_reviews.author: Edward H.

customer_reviews.title: Great winter jacket!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December at a super deal (half-price). Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: seniorocker

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money if you get it on sale.
customer_reviews.text: I paid 125. It’s great. Really warm and good quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It is big, bulky, has an extra 2-3 inches of length, lined pockets. This is the perfect jacket for keeping warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight jacket
customer_reviews.text: Love that’s it’s lightweight & very warm. Not a fan of the Velcro around the wrists though.
customer_reviews.author: Renata Misiolek

customer_reviews.title: Light and warm
customer_reviews.text: Fits very nicely, lightweight and very warm even in -30 C temperatures. Very good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this jacket
customer_reviews.text: High quality jacket. Fits true to size— perhaps slightly narrow in the chest. Very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Tina Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great value in a mid-weight down jacket
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a mid-weight jacket, suitable for use in the 20-40 F. degree range, and this meets that need nicely. Weighing a little over a pound and a half (for men's Large size), it still compresses to about the size of a 1 L Nalgene water bottle. Good value for the money. Nice color (Red). Hood fits nicely over a helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as the product image
customer_reviews.text: I ordered on jet black on wich the marmot logo was showed at the prOduct photo but i got a white logo so... is not like the photograf
customer_reviews.author: Defe-Capo

product_meta.title: Marmot Men's Guides Down Hoody Winter Puffer Jacket, Fill Power 700
product_meta.description: The Men’s Guides Down Hoody is a puffer-style jacket designed for warmth and comfort in harsh conditions. This lightweight winter coat and its attached hood are both insulated with 700 fill power down and protected with Down Defender—a moisture-resistant treatment that keeps the jacket's insulation from clumping and losing its loft when exposed to wet environments, thus increasing its ability to keep you warm when the weather takes a turn for the worse. Additionally, the Guides Hoody features zippered interior and chest pockets for storing small items, zippered handwarmer pockets for thawing cold fingers, adjustable Velcro cuffs and drawcord hem for superior fit and temperature regulation, and Marmot's Angel-Wing Movement for full range of motion.
feature_bullets: Moisture resistant Down Defender treatment on 700 fill power down keeps you warm in wet conditions
Zippered handwarmer pockets offer additional warmth
Zippered chest and interior pockets provide convenient storage
Velcro cuffs and drawcord hem for adjustable fit and temperature control
